00067 /****** HSM Copytool API ********/
00068 #define CT_PRIV_MAGIC 0xC0BE2001
00069 struct hsm_copytool_private {
00070         int                      magic;
00071         char                    *mnt;
00072         struct kuc_hdr          *kuch;
00073         int                      mnt_fd;
00074         int                      open_by_fid_fd;
00075         struct lustre_kernelcomm kuc;
00076         __u32                    archives;
00077 };
00078 
00079 #define CP_PRIV_MAGIC 0x19880429
00080 struct hsm_copyaction_private {
00081         __u32                                    magic;
00082         __s32                                    data_fd;
00083         const struct hsm_copytool_private       *ct_priv;
00084         struct hsm_copy                          copy;
00085         lstat_t                                  stat;
00086 };
00087 
00088 enum ct_progress_type {
00089         CT_START        = 0,
00090         CT_RUNNING      = 50,
00091         CT_FINISH       = 100,
00092         CT_CANCEL       = 150,
00093         CT_ERROR        = 175
00094 };
00095 
00096 enum ct_event {
00097         CT_REGISTER             = 1,
00098         CT_UNREGISTER           = 2,
00099         CT_ARCHIVE_START        = HSMA_ARCHIVE,
00100         CT_ARCHIVE_RUNNING      = HSMA_ARCHIVE + CT_RUNNING,
00101         CT_ARCHIVE_FINISH       = HSMA_ARCHIVE + CT_FINISH,
00102         CT_ARCHIVE_CANCEL       = HSMA_ARCHIVE + CT_CANCEL,
00103         CT_ARCHIVE_ERROR        = HSMA_ARCHIVE + CT_ERROR,
00104         CT_RESTORE_START        = HSMA_RESTORE,
00105         CT_RESTORE_RUNNING      = HSMA_RESTORE + CT_RUNNING,
00106         CT_RESTORE_FINISH       = HSMA_RESTORE + CT_FINISH,
00107         CT_RESTORE_CANCEL       = HSMA_RESTORE + CT_CANCEL,
00108         CT_RESTORE_ERROR        = HSMA_RESTORE + CT_ERROR,
00109         CT_REMOVE_START         = HSMA_REMOVE,
00110         CT_REMOVE_RUNNING       = HSMA_REMOVE + CT_RUNNING,
00111         CT_REMOVE_FINISH        = HSMA_REMOVE + CT_FINISH,
00112         CT_REMOVE_CANCEL        = HSMA_REMOVE + CT_CANCEL,
00113         CT_REMOVE_ERROR         = HSMA_REMOVE + CT_ERROR,
00114         CT_EVENT_MAX
00115 };
00116 
00117 /* initialized in llapi_hsm_register_event_fifo() */
00118 static int llapi_hsm_event_fd = -1;
00119 static bool created_hsm_event_fifo;
00120 
00121 static inline const char *llapi_hsm_ct_ev2str(int type)
00122 {
00123         switch (type) {
00124         case CT_REGISTER:
00125                 return "REGISTER";
00126         case CT_UNREGISTER:
00127                 return "UNREGISTER";
00128         case CT_ARCHIVE_START:
00129                 return "ARCHIVE_START";
00130         case CT_ARCHIVE_RUNNING:
00131                 return "ARCHIVE_RUNNING";
00132         case CT_ARCHIVE_FINISH:
00133                 return "ARCHIVE_FINISH";
00134         case CT_ARCHIVE_CANCEL:
00135                 return "ARCHIVE_CANCEL";
00136         case CT_ARCHIVE_ERROR:
00137                 return "ARCHIVE_ERROR";
00138         case CT_RESTORE_START:
00139                 return "RESTORE_START";
00140         case CT_RESTORE_RUNNING:
00141                 return "RESTORE_RUNNING";
00142         case CT_RESTORE_FINISH:
00143                 return "RESTORE_FINISH";
00144         case CT_RESTORE_CANCEL:
00145                 return "RESTORE_CANCEL";
00146         case CT_RESTORE_ERROR:
00147                 return "RESTORE_ERROR";
00148         case CT_REMOVE_START:
00149                 return "REMOVE_START";
00150         case CT_REMOVE_RUNNING:
00151                 return "REMOVE_RUNNING";
00152         case CT_REMOVE_FINISH:
00153                 return "REMOVE_FINISH";
00154         case CT_REMOVE_CANCEL:
00155                 return "REMOVE_CANCEL";
00156         case CT_REMOVE_ERROR:
00157                 return "REMOVE_ERROR";
00158         default:
00159                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR,
00160                                   "Unknown event type: %d", type);
00161                 return NULL;
00162         }
00163 }
00164 
00175 static int llapi_hsm_write_json_event(struct llapi_json_item_list **event)
00176 {
00177         int                             rc;
00178         char                            time_string[40];
00179         char                            json_buf[PIPE_BUF];
00180         FILE                            *buf_file;
00181         time_t                          event_time = time(0);
00182         struct tm                       time_components;
00183         struct llapi_json_item_list     *json_items;
00184 
00185         /* Noop unless the event fd was initialized */
00186         if (llapi_hsm_event_fd < 0)
00187                 return 0;
00188 
00189         if (event == NULL || *event == NULL)
00190                 return -EINVAL;
00191 
00192         json_items = *event;
00193 
00194         localtime_r(&event_time, &time_components);
00195 
00196         if (strftime(time_string, sizeof(time_string), "%Y-%m-%d %T %z",
00197                      &time_components) == 0) {
00198                 rc = -EINVAL;
00199                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc, "strftime() failed");
00200                 return rc;
00201         }
00202 
00203         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "event_time", LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00204                                  time_string);
00205         if (rc < 0) {
00206                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, -rc, "error in "
00207                             "llapi_json_add_item()");
00208                 return rc;
00209         }
00210 
00211         buf_file = fmemopen(json_buf, sizeof(json_buf), "w");
00212         if (buf_file == NULL)
00213                 return -errno;
00214 
00215         rc = llapi_json_write_list(event, buf_file);
00216         if (rc < 0) {
00217                 fclose(buf_file);
00218                 return rc;
00219         }
00220 
00221         fclose(buf_file);
00222 
00223         if (write(llapi_hsm_event_fd, json_buf, strlen(json_buf)) < 0) {
00224                 /* Ignore write failures due to missing reader. */
00225                 if (errno != EPIPE)
00226                         return -errno;
00227         }
00228 
00229         return 0;
00230 }
00231 
00243 static int llapi_hsm_log_ct_registration(struct hsm_copytool_private **priv,
00244                                          __u32 event_type)
00245 {
00246         int                             rc;
00247         char                            agent_uuid[UUID_MAX];
00248         struct hsm_copytool_private     *ct;
00249         struct llapi_json_item_list     *json_items;
00250 
00251         /* Noop unless the event fd was initialized */
00252         if (llapi_hsm_event_fd < 0)
00253                 return 0;
00254 
00255         if (priv == NULL || *priv == NULL)
00256                 return -EINVAL;
00257 
00258         ct = *priv;
00259         if (ct->magic != CT_PRIV_MAGIC)
00260                 return -EINVAL;
00261 
00262         if (event_type != CT_REGISTER && event_type != CT_UNREGISTER)
00263                 return -EINVAL;
00264 
00265         rc = llapi_json_init_list(&json_items);
00266         if (rc < 0)
00267                 goto err;
00268 
00269         rc = llapi_get_agent_uuid(ct->mnt, agent_uuid, sizeof(agent_uuid));
00270         if (rc < 0)
00271                 goto err;
00272         llapi_chomp_string(agent_uuid);
00273 
00274         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "uuid", LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00275                                  agent_uuid);
00276         if (rc < 0)
00277                 goto err;
00278 
00279         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "mount_point", LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00280                                  ct->mnt);
00281         if (rc < 0)
00282                 goto err;
00283 
00284         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "archive", LLAPI_JSON_INTEGER,
00285                                  &ct->archives);
00286         if (rc < 0)
00287                 goto err;
00288 
00289         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "event_type", LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00290                                  (char *)llapi_hsm_ct_ev2str(event_type));
00291         if (rc < 0)
00292                 goto err;
00293 
00294         rc = llapi_hsm_write_json_event(&json_items);
00295         if (rc < 0)
00296                 goto err;
00297 
00298         goto out_free;
00299 
00300 err:
00301         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc, "error in "
00302                     "llapi_hsm_log_ct_registration()");
00303 
00304 out_free:
00305         if (json_items != NULL)
00306                 llapi_json_destroy_list(&json_items);
00307 
00308         return rc;
00309 }
00310 
00352 static int llapi_hsm_log_ct_progress(struct hsm_copyaction_private **phcp,
00353                                      const struct hsm_action_item *hai,
00354                                      __u32 progress_type,
00355                                      __u64 total, __u64 current)
00356 {
00357         int                             rc;
00358         int                             linkno = 0;
00359         long long                       recno = -1;
00360         char                            lustre_path[PATH_MAX];
00361         char                            strfid[FID_NOBRACE_LEN + 1];
00362         struct hsm_copyaction_private   *hcp;
00363         struct llapi_json_item_list     *json_items;
00364 
00365         /* Noop unless the event fd was initialized */
00366         if (llapi_hsm_event_fd < 0)
00367                 return 0;
00368 
00369         if (phcp == NULL || *phcp == NULL)
00370                 return -EINVAL;
00371 
00372         hcp = *phcp;
00373 
00374         rc = llapi_json_init_list(&json_items);
00375         if (rc < 0)
00376                 goto err;
00377 
00378         snprintf(strfid, sizeof(strfid), DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(&hai->hai_dfid));
00379         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "data_fid",
00380                                  LLAPI_JSON_STRING, strfid);
00381         if (rc < 0)
00382                 goto err;
00383 
00384         snprintf(strfid, sizeof(strfid), DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(&hai->hai_fid));
00385         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "source_fid",
00386                                  LLAPI_JSON_STRING, strfid);
00387         if (rc < 0)
00388                 goto err;
00389 
00390         if (hcp->copy.hc_errval == ECANCELED) {
00391                 progress_type = CT_CANCEL;
00392                 goto cancel;
00393         }
00394 
00395         if (hcp->copy.hc_errval != 0) {
00396                 progress_type = CT_ERROR;
00397 
00398                 rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "errno",
00399                                          LLAPI_JSON_INTEGER,
00400                                          &hcp->copy.hc_errval);
00401                 if (rc < 0)
00402                         goto err;
00403 
00404                 rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "error",
00405                                          LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00406                                          strerror(hcp->copy.hc_errval));
00407                 if (rc < 0)
00408                         goto err;
00409 
00410                 goto cancel;
00411         }
00412 
00413         /* lustre_path isn't available after a restore completes */
00414         /* total_bytes isn't available after a restore or archive completes */
00415         if (progress_type != CT_FINISH) {
00416                 rc = llapi_fid2path(hcp->ct_priv->mnt, strfid, lustre_path,
00417                                     sizeof(lustre_path), &recno, &linkno);
00418                 if (rc < 0)
00419                         goto err;
00420 
00421                 rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "lustre_path",
00422                                          LLAPI_JSON_STRING, lustre_path);
00423                 if (rc < 0)
00424                         goto err;
00425 
00426                 rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "total_bytes",
00427                                          LLAPI_JSON_BIGNUM, &total);
00428                 if (rc < 0)
00429                         goto err;
00430         }
00431 
00432         if (progress_type == CT_RUNNING)
00433                 rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "current_bytes",
00434                                          LLAPI_JSON_BIGNUM, &current);
00435                 if (rc < 0)
00436                         goto err;
00437 
00438 cancel:
00439         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "event_type", LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00440                                  (char *)llapi_hsm_ct_ev2str(hai->hai_action +
00441                                                              progress_type));
00442         if (rc < 0)
00443                 goto err;
00444 
00445         rc = llapi_hsm_write_json_event(&json_items);
00446         if (rc < 0)
00447                 goto err;
00448 
00449         goto out_free;
00450 
00451 err:
00452         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc, "error in "
00453                     "llapi_hsm_log_ct_progress()");
00454 
00455 out_free:
00456         if (json_items != NULL)
00457                 llapi_json_destroy_list(&json_items);
00458 
00459         return rc;
00460 }
00461 
00473 int llapi_hsm_register_event_fifo(const char *path)
00474 {
00475         int read_fd;
00476         struct stat statbuf;
00477         struct sigaction ignore_action;
00478         int rc;
00479 
00480         /* Create the FIFO if necessary. */
00481         if ((mkfifo(path, 0644) < 0) && (errno != EEXIST)) {
00482                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, errno, "mkfifo(%s) failed", path);
00483                 return -errno;
00484         }
00485         if (errno == EEXIST) {
00486                 if (stat(path, &statbuf) < 0) {
00487                         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, errno, "mkfifo(%s) failed",
00488                                     path);
00489                         return -errno;
00490                 }
00491                 if (!S_ISFIFO(statbuf.st_mode) ||
00492                     ((statbuf.st_mode & 0777) != 0644)) {
00493                         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, errno, "%s exists but is "
00494                                     "not a pipe or has a wrong mode", path);
00495                         return -errno;
00496                 }
00497         } else {
00498                 created_hsm_event_fifo = true;
00499         }
00500 
00501         /* Open the FIFO for read so that the subsequent open for write
00502          * doesn't immediately fail. */
00503         read_fd = open(path, O_RDONLY | O_NONBLOCK);
00504         if (read_fd < 0) {
00505                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, errno,
00506                             "cannot open(%s) for read", path);
00507                 return -errno;
00508         }
00509 
00510         /* Open the FIFO for writes, but don't block on waiting
00511          * for a reader. */
00512         llapi_hsm_event_fd = open(path, O_WRONLY | O_NONBLOCK);
00513         rc = -errno;
00514 
00515         /* Now close the reader. An external monitoring process can
00516          * now open the FIFO for reads. If no reader comes along the
00517          * events are lost. NOTE: Only one reader at a time! */
00518         close(read_fd);
00519 
00520         if (llapi_hsm_event_fd < 0) {
00521                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, -rc,
00522                             "cannot open(%s) for write", path);
00523                 return rc;
00524         }
00525 
00526         /* Ignore SIGPIPEs -- can occur if the reader goes away. */
00527         memset(&ignore_action, 0, sizeof(ignore_action));
00528         ignore_action.sa_handler = SIG_IGN;
00529         sigemptyset(&ignore_action.sa_mask);
00530         sigaction(SIGPIPE, &ignore_action, NULL);
00531 
00532         return 0;
00533 }
00534 
00543 int llapi_hsm_unregister_event_fifo(const char *path)
00544 {
00545         /* Noop unless the event fd was initialized */
00546         if (llapi_hsm_event_fd < 0)
00547                 return 0;
00548 
00549         if (close(llapi_hsm_event_fd) < 0)
00550                 return -errno;
00551 
00552         if (created_hsm_event_fifo) {
00553                 unlink(path);
00554                 created_hsm_event_fifo = false;
00555         }
00556 
00557         llapi_hsm_event_fd = -1;
00558 
00559         return 0;
00560 }
00561 
00574 void llapi_hsm_log_error(enum llapi_message_level level, int _rc,
00575                          const char *fmt, va_list args)
00576 {
00577         int                             rc;
00578         int                             msg_len;
00579         int                             real_level;
00580         char                            *msg = NULL;
00581         va_list                         args2;
00582         struct llapi_json_item_list     *json_items;
00583 
00584         /* Noop unless the event fd was initialized */
00585         if (llapi_hsm_event_fd < 0)
00586                 return;
00587 
00588         rc = llapi_json_init_list(&json_items);
00589         if (rc < 0)
00590                 goto err;
00591 
00592         if ((level & LLAPI_MSG_NO_ERRNO) == 0) {
00593                 rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "errno",
00594                                          LLAPI_JSON_INTEGER,
00595                                          &_rc);
00596                 if (rc < 0)
00597                         goto err;
00598 
00599                 rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "error",
00600                                          LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00601                                          strerror(abs(_rc)));
00602                 if (rc < 0)
00603                         goto err;
00604         }
00605 
00606         va_copy(args2, args);
00607         msg_len = vsnprintf(NULL, 0, fmt, args2) + 1;
00608         va_end(args2);
00609         if (msg_len >= 0) {
00610                 msg = (char *) alloca(msg_len);
00611                 if (msg == NULL) {
00612                         rc = -ENOMEM;
00613                         goto err;
00614                 }
00615 
00616                 rc = vsnprintf(msg, msg_len, fmt, args);
00617                 if (rc < 0)
00618                         goto err;
00619 
00620                 rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "message",
00621                                          LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00622                                          msg);
00623                 if (rc < 0)
00624                         goto err;
00625         } else {
00626                 rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "message",
00627                                          LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00628                                          "INTERNAL ERROR: message failed");
00629                 if (rc < 0)
00630                         goto err;
00631         }
00632 
00633         real_level = level & LLAPI_MSG_NO_ERRNO;
00634         real_level = real_level > 0 ? level - LLAPI_MSG_NO_ERRNO : level;
00635 
00636         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "level", LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00637                                  (void *)llapi_msg_level2str(real_level));
00638         if (rc < 0)
00639                 goto err;
00640 
00641         rc = llapi_json_add_item(&json_items, "event_type", LLAPI_JSON_STRING,
00642                                  "LOGGED_MESSAGE");
00643         if (rc < 0)
00644                 goto err;
00645 
00646         rc = llapi_hsm_write_json_event(&json_items);
00647         if (rc < 0)
00648                 goto err;
00649 
00650         goto out_free;
00651 
00652 err:
00653         /* Write directly to stderr to avoid llapi_error, which now
00654          * emits JSON event messages. */
00655         fprintf(stderr, "\nFATAL ERROR IN llapi_hsm_log_error(): rc %d,", rc);
00656 
00657 out_free:
00658         if (json_items != NULL)
00659                 llapi_json_destroy_list(&json_items);
00660 
00661         return;
00662 }
00663 
00676 int llapi_hsm_copytool_register(struct hsm_copytool_private **priv,
00677                                 const char *mnt, int archive_count,
00678                                 int *archives, int rfd_flags)
00679 {
00680         struct hsm_copytool_private     *ct;
00681         int                              rc;
00682 
00683         if (archive_count > 0 && archives == NULL) {
00684                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR,
00685                                   "NULL archive numbers");
00686                 return -EINVAL;
00687         }
00688 
00689         if (archive_count > LL_HSM_MAX_ARCHIVE) {
00690                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, "%d requested when maximum "
00691                                   "of %zu archives supported", archive_count,
00692                                   LL_HSM_MAX_ARCHIVE);
00693                 return -EINVAL;
00694         }
00695 
00696         ct = calloc(1, sizeof(*ct));
00697         if (ct == NULL)
00698                 return -ENOMEM;
00699 
00700         ct->magic = CT_PRIV_MAGIC;
00701         ct->mnt_fd = -1;
00702         ct->open_by_fid_fd = -1;
00703         ct->kuc.lk_rfd = LK_NOFD;
00704         ct->kuc.lk_wfd = LK_NOFD;
00705 
00706         ct->mnt = strdup(mnt);
00707         if (ct->mnt == NULL) {
00708                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00709                 goto out_err;
00710         }
00711 
00712         ct->kuch = malloc(HAL_MAXSIZE + sizeof(*ct->kuch));
00713         if (ct->kuch == NULL) {
00714                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00715                 goto out_err;
00716         }
00717 
00718         ct->mnt_fd = open(ct->mnt, O_RDONLY);
00719         if (ct->mnt_fd < 0) {
00720                 rc = -errno;
00721                 goto out_err;
00722         }
00723 
00724         ct->open_by_fid_fd = openat(ct->mnt_fd, OPEN_BY_FID_PATH, O_RDONLY);
00725         if (ct->open_by_fid_fd < 0) {
00726                 rc = -errno;
00727                 goto out_err;
00728         }
00729 
00730         /* no archives specified means "match all". */
00731         ct->archives = 0;
00732         for (rc = 0; rc < archive_count; rc++) {
00733                 if ((archives[rc] > LL_HSM_MAX_ARCHIVE) || (archives[rc] < 0)) {
00734                         llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, "%d requested when "
00735                                           "archive id [0 - %zu] is supported",
00736                                           archives[rc], LL_HSM_MAX_ARCHIVE);
00737                         rc = -EINVAL;
00738                         goto out_err;
00739                 }
00740                 /* in the list we have an all archive wildcard
00741                  * so move to all archives mode
00742                  */
00743                 if (archives[rc] == 0) {
00744                         ct->archives = 0;
00745                         archive_count = 0;
00746                         break;
00747                 }
00748                 ct->archives |= (1 << (archives[rc] - 1));
00749         }
00750 
00751         rc = libcfs_ukuc_start(&ct->kuc, KUC_GRP_HSM, rfd_flags);
00752         if (rc < 0)
00753                 goto out_err;
00754 
00755         /* Storing archive(s) in lk_data; see mdc_ioc_hsm_ct_start */
00756         ct->kuc.lk_data = ct->archives;
00757         rc = ioctl(ct->mnt_fd, LL_IOC_HSM_CT_START, &ct->kuc);
00758         if (rc < 0) {
00759                 rc = -errno;
00760                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00761                             "cannot start copytool on '%s'", mnt);
00762                 goto out_kuc;
00763         }
00764 
00765         llapi_hsm_log_ct_registration(&ct, CT_REGISTER);
00766 
00767         /* Only the kernel reference keeps the write side open */
00768         close(ct->kuc.lk_wfd);
00769         ct->kuc.lk_wfd = LK_NOFD;
00770         *priv = ct;
00771 
00772         return 0;
00773 
00774 out_kuc:
00775         /* cleanup the kuc channel */
00776         libcfs_ukuc_stop(&ct->kuc);
00777 
00778 out_err:
00779         if (!(ct->mnt_fd < 0))
00780                 close(ct->mnt_fd);
00781 
00782         if (!(ct->open_by_fid_fd < 0))
00783                 close(ct->open_by_fid_fd);
00784 
00785         free(ct->mnt);
00786 
00787         free(ct->kuch);
00788 
00789         free(ct);
00790 
00791         return rc;
00792 }
00793 
00799 int llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister(struct hsm_copytool_private **priv)
00800 {
00801         struct hsm_copytool_private *ct;
00802 
00803         if (priv == NULL || *priv == NULL)
00804                 return -EINVAL;
00805 
00806         ct = *priv;
00807         if (ct->magic != CT_PRIV_MAGIC)
00808                 return -EINVAL;
00809 
00810         /* Close the read side of the KUC pipe. This should be done
00811          * before unregistering to avoid deadlock: a ldlm_cb thread
00812          * enters libcfs_kkuc_group_put() acquires kg_sem and blocks
00813          * in pipe_write() due to full pipe; then we attempt to
00814          * unregister and block on kg_sem. */
00815         libcfs_ukuc_stop(&ct->kuc);
00816 
00817         /* Tell the kernel to stop sending us messages */
00818         ct->kuc.lk_flags = LK_FLG_STOP;
00819         ioctl(ct->mnt_fd, LL_IOC_HSM_CT_START, &ct->kuc);
00820 
00821         llapi_hsm_log_ct_registration(&ct, CT_UNREGISTER);
00822 
00823         close(ct->open_by_fid_fd);
00824         close(ct->mnt_fd);
00825         free(ct->mnt);
00826         free(ct->kuch);
00827         free(ct);
00828         *priv = NULL;
00829 
00830         return 0;
00831 }
00832 
00838 int llapi_hsm_copytool_get_fd(struct hsm_copytool_private *ct)
00839 {
00840         if (ct == NULL || ct->magic != CT_PRIV_MAGIC)
00841                 return -EINVAL;
00842 
00843         return libcfs_ukuc_get_rfd(&ct->kuc);
00844 }
00845 
00855 int llapi_hsm_copytool_recv(struct hsm_copytool_private *ct,
00856                             struct hsm_action_list **halh, int *msgsize)
00857 {
00858         struct kuc_hdr          *kuch;
00859         struct hsm_action_list  *hal;
00860         int                      rc = 0;
00861 
00862         if (ct == NULL || ct->magic != CT_PRIV_MAGIC)
00863                 return -EINVAL;
00864 
00865         if (halh == NULL || msgsize == NULL)
00866                 return -EINVAL;
00867 
00868         kuch = ct->kuch;
00869 
00870 repeat:
00871         rc = libcfs_ukuc_msg_get(&ct->kuc, (char *)kuch,
00872                                  HAL_MAXSIZE + sizeof(*kuch),
00873                                  KUC_TRANSPORT_HSM);
00874         if (rc < 0)
00875                 goto out_err;
00876 
00877         /* Handle generic messages */
00878         if (kuch->kuc_transport == KUC_TRANSPORT_GENERIC &&
00879             kuch->kuc_msgtype == KUC_MSG_SHUTDOWN) {
00880                 rc = -ESHUTDOWN;
00881                 goto out_err;
00882         }
00883 
00884         if (kuch->kuc_transport != KUC_TRANSPORT_HSM ||
00885             kuch->kuc_msgtype != HMT_ACTION_LIST) {
00886                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR,
00887                                   "Unknown HSM message type %d:%d\n",
00888                                   kuch->kuc_transport, kuch->kuc_msgtype);
00889                 rc = -EPROTO;
00890                 goto out_err;
00891         }
00892 
00893         if (kuch->kuc_msglen < sizeof(*kuch) + sizeof(*hal)) {
00894                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, "Short HSM message %d",
00895                                   kuch->kuc_msglen);
00896                 rc = -EPROTO;
00897                 goto out_err;
00898         }
00899 
00900         /* Our message is a hsm_action_list. Use pointer math to skip
00901         * kuch_hdr and point directly to the message payload.
00902         */
00903         hal = (struct hsm_action_list *)(kuch + 1);
00904 
00905         /* Check that we have registered for this archive #
00906          * if 0 registered, we serve any archive */
00907         if (ct->archives &&
00908             ((1 << (hal->hal_archive_id - 1)) & ct->archives) == 0) {
00909                 llapi_err_noerrno(LLAPI_MSG_INFO,
00910                                   "This copytool does not service archive #%d,"
00911                                   " ignoring this request."
00912                                   " Mask of served archive is 0x%.8X",
00913                                   hal->hal_archive_id, ct->archives);
00914 
00915                 goto repeat;
00916         }
00917 
00918         *halh = hal;
00919         *msgsize = kuch->kuc_msglen - sizeof(*kuch);
00920         return 0;
00921 
00922 out_err:
00923         *halh = NULL;
00924         *msgsize = 0;
00925         return rc;
00926 }
00927 
00936 static int fid_parent(const char *mnt, const lustre_fid *fid, char *parent,
00937                       size_t parent_len)
00938 {
00939         int              rc;
00940         int              linkno = 0;
00941         long long        recno = -1;
00942         char             file[PATH_MAX];
00943         char             strfid[FID_NOBRACE_LEN + 1];
00944         char            *ptr;
00945 
00946         snprintf(strfid, sizeof(strfid), DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(fid));
00947 
00948         rc = llapi_fid2path(mnt, strfid, file, sizeof(file),
00949                             &recno, &linkno);
00950         if (rc < 0)
00951                 return rc;
00952 
00953         /* fid2path returns a relative path */
00954         rc = snprintf(parent, parent_len, "%s/%s", mnt, file);
00955         if (rc >= parent_len)
00956                 return -ENAMETOOLONG;
00957 
00958         /* remove file name */
00959         ptr = strrchr(parent, '/');
00960         if (ptr == NULL || ptr == parent) {
00961                 rc = -EINVAL;
00962         } else {
00963                 *ptr = '\0';
00964                 rc = 0;
00965         }
00966 
00967         return rc;
00968 }
00969 
00970 static int ct_open_by_fid(const struct hsm_copytool_private *ct,
00971                           const struct lu_fid *fid, int open_flags)
00972 {
00973         char fid_name[FID_NOBRACE_LEN + 1];
00974         int fd;
00975 
00976         snprintf(fid_name, sizeof(fid_name), DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(fid));
00977 
00978         fd = openat(ct->open_by_fid_fd, fid_name, open_flags);
00979         return fd < 0 ? -errno : fd;
00980 }
00981 
00991 static int ct_md_getattr(const struct hsm_copytool_private *ct,
00992                          const struct lu_fid *fid,
00993                          lstat_t *st)
00994 {
00995         struct lov_user_mds_data *lmd;
00996         size_t lmd_size;
00997         int rc;
00998 
00999         lmd_size = sizeof(lmd->lmd_st) +
01000                 lov_user_md_size(LOV_MAX_STRIPE_COUNT, LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3);
01001 
01002         if (lmd_size < sizeof(lmd->lmd_st) + XATTR_SIZE_MAX)
01003                 lmd_size = sizeof(lmd->lmd_st) + XATTR_SIZE_MAX;
01004 
01005         if (lmd_size < FID_NOBRACE_LEN + 1)
01006                 lmd_size = FID_NOBRACE_LEN + 1;
01007 
01008         lmd = malloc(lmd_size);
01009         if (lmd == NULL)
01010                 return -ENOMEM;
01011 
01012         snprintf((char *)lmd, lmd_size, DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(fid));
01013 
01014         rc = ioctl(ct->open_by_fid_fd, IOC_MDC_GETFILEINFO, lmd);
01015         if (rc != 0) {
01016                 rc = -errno;
01017                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
01018                             "cannot get metadata attributes of "DFID" in '%s'",
01019                             PFID(fid), ct->mnt);
01020                 goto out;
01021         }
01022 
01023         *st = lmd->lmd_st;
01024 out:
01025         free(lmd);
01026 
01027         return rc;
01028 }
01029 
01037 static int create_restore_volatile(struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp,
01038                                    int mdt_index, int open_flags)
01039 {
01040         int                      rc;
01041         int                      fd;
01042         char                     parent[PATH_MAX + 1];
01043         const char              *mnt = hcp->ct_priv->mnt;
01044         struct hsm_action_item  *hai = &hcp->copy.hc_hai;
01045 
01046         rc = fid_parent(mnt, &hai->hai_fid, parent, sizeof(parent));
01047         if (rc < 0) {
01048                 /* fid_parent() failed, try to keep on going */
01049                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
01050                             "cannot get parent path to restore "DFID" "
01051                             "using '%s'", PFID(&hai->hai_fid), mnt);
01052                 snprintf(parent, sizeof(parent), "%s", mnt);
01053         }
01054 
01055         fd = llapi_create_volatile_idx(parent, mdt_index, open_flags);
01056         if (fd < 0)
01057                 return fd;
01058 
01059         rc = fchown(fd, hcp->stat.st_uid, hcp->stat.st_gid);
01060         if (rc < 0)
01061                 goto err_cleanup;
01062 
01063         rc = llapi_fd2fid(fd, &hai->hai_dfid);
01064         if (rc < 0)
01065                 goto err_cleanup;
01066 
01067         hcp->data_fd = fd;
01068 
01069         return 0;
01070 
01071 err_cleanup:
01072         hcp->data_fd = -1;
01073         close(fd);
01074 
01075         return rc;
01076 }
01077 
01096 int llapi_hsm_action_begin(struct hsm_copyaction_private **phcp,
01097                            const struct hsm_copytool_private *ct,
01098                            const struct hsm_action_item *hai,
01099                            int restore_mdt_index, int restore_open_flags,
01100                            bool is_error)
01101 {
01102         struct hsm_copyaction_private   *hcp;
01103         int                              rc;
01104 
01105         hcp = calloc(1, sizeof(*hcp));
01106         if (hcp == NULL)
01107                 return -ENOMEM;
01108 
01109         hcp->data_fd = -1;
01110         hcp->ct_priv = ct;
01111         hcp->copy.hc_hai = *hai;
01112         hcp->copy.hc_hai.hai_len = sizeof(*hai);
01113 
01114         if (is_error)
01115                 goto ok_out;
01116 
01117         if (hai->hai_action == HSMA_RESTORE) {
01118                 rc = ct_md_getattr(hcp->ct_priv, &hai->hai_fid, &hcp->stat);
01119                 if (rc < 0)
01120                         goto err_out;
01121 
01122                 rc = create_restore_volatile(hcp, restore_mdt_index,
01123                                              restore_open_flags);
01124                 if (rc < 0)
01125                         goto err_out;
01126         }
01127 
01128         rc = ioctl(ct->mnt_fd, LL_IOC_HSM_COPY_START, &hcp->copy);
01129         if (rc < 0) {
01130                 rc = -errno;
01131                 goto err_out;
01132         }
01133 
01134         llapi_hsm_log_ct_progress(&hcp, hai, CT_START, 0, 0);
01135 
01136 ok_out:
01137         hcp->magic = CP_PRIV_MAGIC;
01138         *phcp = hcp;
01139         return 0;
01140 
01141 err_out:
01142         if (!(hcp->data_fd < 0))
01143                 close(hcp->data_fd);
01144 
01145         free(hcp);
01146 
01147         return rc;
01148 }
01149 
01160 int llapi_hsm_action_end(struct hsm_copyaction_private **phcp,
01161                          const struct hsm_extent *he, int hp_flags, int errval)
01162 {
01163         struct hsm_copyaction_private   *hcp;
01164         struct hsm_action_item          *hai;
01165         int                              rc;
01166 
01167         if (phcp == NULL || *phcp == NULL || he == NULL)
01168                 return -EINVAL;
01169 
01170         hcp = *phcp;
01171 
01172         if (hcp->magic != CP_PRIV_MAGIC)
01173                 return -EINVAL;
01174 
01175         hai = &hcp->copy.hc_hai;
01176 
01177         if (hai->hai_action == HSMA_RESTORE && errval == 0) {
01178                 struct ll_futimes_3 lfu = {
01179                         .lfu_atime_sec = hcp->stat.st_atim.tv_sec,
01180                         .lfu_atime_nsec = hcp->stat.st_atim.tv_nsec,
01181                         .lfu_mtime_sec = hcp->stat.st_mtim.tv_sec,
01182                         .lfu_mtime_nsec = hcp->stat.st_mtim.tv_nsec,
01183                         .lfu_ctime_sec = hcp->stat.st_ctim.tv_sec,
01184                         .lfu_ctime_nsec = hcp->stat.st_ctim.tv_nsec,
01185                 };
01186 
01187                 rc = fsync(hcp->data_fd);
01188                 if (rc < 0) {
01189                         errval = -errno;
01190                         goto end;
01191                 }
01192 
01193                 /* Set {a,m,c}time of volatile file to that of original. */
01194                 rc = ioctl(hcp->data_fd, LL_IOC_FUTIMES_3, &lfu);
01195                 if (rc < 0) {
01196                         errval = -errno;
01197                         goto end;
01198                 }
01199         }
01200 
01201 end:
01202         /* In some cases, like restore, 2 FIDs are used.
01203          * Set the right FID to use here. */
01204         if (hai->hai_action == HSMA_ARCHIVE || hai->hai_action == HSMA_RESTORE)
01205                 hai->hai_fid = hai->hai_dfid;
01206 
01207         /* Fill the last missing data that will be needed by
01208          * kernel to send a hsm_progress. */
01209         hcp->copy.hc_flags  = hp_flags;
01210         hcp->copy.hc_errval = abs(errval);
01211 
01212         hcp->copy.hc_hai.hai_extent = *he;
01213 
01214         rc = ioctl(hcp->ct_priv->mnt_fd, LL_IOC_HSM_COPY_END, &hcp->copy);
01215         if (rc) {
01216                 rc = -errno;
01217                 goto err_cleanup;
01218         }
01219 
01220         llapi_hsm_log_ct_progress(&hcp, hai, CT_FINISH, 0, 0);
01221 
01222 err_cleanup:
01223         if (!(hcp->data_fd < 0))
01224                 close(hcp->data_fd);
01225 
01226         free(hcp);
01227         *phcp = NULL;
01228 
01229         return rc;
01230 }
01231 
01239 int llapi_hsm_action_progress(struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp,
01240                               const struct hsm_extent *he, __u64 total,
01241                               int hp_flags)
01242 {
01243         int                      rc;
01244         struct hsm_progress      hp;
01245         struct hsm_action_item  *hai;
01246 
01247         if (hcp == NULL || he == NULL)
01248                 return -EINVAL;
01249 
01250         if (hcp->magic != CP_PRIV_MAGIC)
01251                 return -EINVAL;
01252 
01253         hai = &hcp->copy.hc_hai;
01254 
01255         memset(&hp, 0, sizeof(hp));
01256 
01257         hp.hp_cookie = hai->hai_cookie;
01258         hp.hp_flags  = hp_flags;
01259 
01260         /* Progress is made on the data fid */
01261         hp.hp_fid = hai->hai_dfid;
01262         hp.hp_extent = *he;
01263 
01264         rc = ioctl(hcp->ct_priv->mnt_fd, LL_IOC_HSM_PROGRESS, &hp);
01265         if (rc < 0)
01266                 rc = -errno;
01267 
01268         llapi_hsm_log_ct_progress(&hcp, hai, CT_RUNNING, total, he->length);
01269 
01270         return rc;
01271 }
01272 
01276 int llapi_hsm_action_get_dfid(const struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp,
01277                               lustre_fid *fid)
01278 {
01279         const struct hsm_action_item    *hai = &hcp->copy.hc_hai;
01280 
01281         if (hcp->magic != CP_PRIV_MAGIC)
01282                 return -EINVAL;
01283 
01284         if (hai->hai_action != HSMA_RESTORE && hai->hai_action != HSMA_ARCHIVE)
01285                 return -EINVAL;
01286 
01287         *fid = hai->hai_dfid;
01288 
01289         return 0;
01290 }
01291 
01299 int llapi_hsm_action_get_fd(const struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp)
01300 {
01301         const struct hsm_action_item    *hai = &hcp->copy.hc_hai;
01302         int fd;
01303 
01304         if (hcp->magic != CP_PRIV_MAGIC)
01305                 return -EINVAL;
01306 
01307         if (hai->hai_action == HSMA_ARCHIVE) {
01308                 return ct_open_by_fid(hcp->ct_priv, &hai->hai_dfid,
01309                                 O_RDONLY | O_NOATIME | O_NOFOLLOW | O_NONBLOCK);
01310         } else if (hai->hai_action == HSMA_RESTORE) {
01311                 fd = dup(hcp->data_fd);
01312                 return fd < 0 ? -errno : fd;
01313         } else {
01314                 return -EINVAL;
01315         }
01316 }
01317 
01331 int llapi_hsm_import(const char *dst, int archive, const struct stat *st,
01332                      unsigned long long stripe_size, int stripe_offset,
01333                      int stripe_count, int stripe_pattern, char *pool_name,
01334                      lustre_fid *newfid)
01335 {
01336         struct hsm_user_import   hui;
01337         int                      fd;
01338         int                      rc = 0;
01339 
01340         if (stripe_pattern == 0)
01341                 stripe_pattern = LOV_PATTERN_RAID0;
01342 
01343         /* Create a non-striped file */
01344         fd = llapi_file_open_pool(dst, O_CREAT | O_WRONLY, st->st_mode,
01345                                   stripe_size, stripe_offset, stripe_count,
01346                                   stripe_pattern | LOV_PATTERN_F_RELEASED,
01347                                   pool_name);
01348         if (fd < 0) {
01349                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, fd,
01350                             "cannot create '%s' for import", dst);
01351                 return fd;
01352         }
01353 
01354         /* Get the new fid in Lustre. Caller needs to use this fid
01355            from now on. */
01356         rc = llapi_fd2fid(fd, newfid);
01357         if (rc != 0) {
01358                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
01359                             "cannot get fid of '%s' for import", dst);
01360                 goto out_unlink;
01361         }
01362 
01363         hui.hui_uid = st->st_uid;
01364         hui.hui_gid = st->st_gid;
01365         hui.hui_mode = st->st_mode;
01366         hui.hui_size = st->st_size;
01367         hui.hui_archive_id = archive;
01368         hui.hui_atime = st->st_atime;
01369         hui.hui_atime_ns = st->st_atim.tv_nsec;
01370         hui.hui_mtime = st->st_mtime;
01371         hui.hui_mtime_ns = st->st_mtim.tv_nsec;
01372         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_HSM_IMPORT, &hui);
01373         if (rc != 0) {
01374                 rc = -errno;
01375                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc, "cannot import '%s'", dst);
01376                 goto out_unlink;
01377         }
01378 
01379 out_unlink:
01380         if (fd >= 0)
01381                 close(fd);
01382         if (rc)
01383                 unlink(dst);
01384         return rc;
01385 }
01386 
01397 int llapi_hsm_state_get_fd(int fd, struct hsm_user_state *hus)
01398 {
01399         int rc;
01400 
01401         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_HSM_STATE_GET, hus);
01402         /* If error, save errno value */
01403         rc = rc ? -errno : 0;
01404 
01405         return rc;
01406 }
01407 
01414 int llapi_hsm_state_get(const char *path, struct hsm_user_state *hus)
01415 {
01416         int fd;
01417         int rc;
01418 
01419         fd = open(path, O_RDONLY | O_NONBLOCK);
01420         if (fd < 0)
01421                 return -errno;
01422 
01423         rc = llapi_hsm_state_get_fd(fd, hus);
01424 
01425         close(fd);
01426         return rc;
01427 }
01428 
01443 int llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(int fd, __u64 setmask, __u64 clearmask,
01444                            __u32 archive_id)
01445 {
01446         struct hsm_state_set     hss;
01447         int                      rc;
01448 
01449         hss.hss_valid = HSS_SETMASK|HSS_CLEARMASK;
01450         hss.hss_setmask = setmask;
01451         hss.hss_clearmask = clearmask;
01452         /* Change archive_id if provided. We can only change
01453          * to set something different than 0. */
01454         if (archive_id > 0) {
01455                 hss.hss_valid |= HSS_ARCHIVE_ID;
01456                 hss.hss_archive_id = archive_id;
01457         }
01458         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_HSM_STATE_SET, &hss);
01459         /* If error, save errno value */
01460         rc = rc ? -errno : 0;
01461 
01462         return rc;
01463 }
01464 
01470 int llapi_hsm_state_set(const char *path, __u64 setmask, __u64 clearmask,
01471                         __u32 archive_id)
01472 {
01473         int fd;
01474         int rc;
01475 
01476         fd = open(path, O_WRONLY | O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE | O_NONBLOCK);
01477         if (fd < 0)
01478                 return -errno;
01479 
01480         rc = llapi_hsm_state_set_fd(fd, setmask, clearmask, archive_id);
01481 
01482         close(fd);
01483         return rc;
01484 }
01485 
01495 int llapi_hsm_current_action(const char *path, struct hsm_current_action *hca)
01496 {
01497         int fd;
01498         int rc;
01499 
01500         fd = open(path, O_RDONLY | O_NONBLOCK);
01501         if (fd < 0)
01502                 return -errno;
01503 
01504         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_HSM_ACTION, hca);
01505         /* If error, save errno value */
01506         rc = rc ? -errno : 0;
01507 
01508         close(fd);
01509         return rc;
01510 }
01511 
01518 struct hsm_user_request *llapi_hsm_user_request_alloc(int itemcount,
01519                                                       int data_len)
01520 {
01521         int len = 0;
01522 
01523         len += sizeof(struct hsm_user_request);
01524         len += sizeof(struct hsm_user_item) * itemcount;
01525         len += data_len;
01526 
01527         return (struct hsm_user_request *)malloc(len);
01528 }
01529 
01538 int llapi_hsm_request(const char *path, const struct hsm_user_request *request)
01539 {
01540         int rc;
01541         int fd;
01542 
01543         rc = get_root_path(WANT_FD, NULL, &fd, (char *)path, -1);
01544         if (rc)
01545                 return rc;
01546 
01547         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_HSM_REQUEST, request);
01548         /* If error, save errno value */
01549         rc = rc ? -errno : 0;
01550 
01551         close(fd);
01552         return rc;
01553 }
